title: Advertising = NOT Advertising, Slice Of Hot Sauce? 1.27.21
itunes:title: Advertising = NOT Advertising, Slice Of Hot Sauce? 1.27.21
description:
In episode 799, Jack and Miles are joined by comedian Alex Edelman to discuss rich people hunting for vaccines, Covid as a case study for climate change, Florida attempting to get the Summer Olympics, hot sauce slices, super bowl commercials, and more!

FOOTNOTES:

  1. Hollywood Elite in COVID-19 Vaccine Scramble: ‘It’s the Hunger Games Out There’
  2. Wealthy couple chartered a plane to the Yukon, took vaccines doses meant for Indigenous elders, authorities said
  3. I’ve Said Goodbye to ‘Normal.’ You Should, Too.
  4. CFO Jimmy Patronis to Olympic Committee: Relocate the 2021 Olympics from Tokyo to Florida
  5. Frank's RedHot Sauce Will Soon Come in a Sandwich-Ready 'Slice' Form
  6. Wary Companies Hesitate on Super Bowl Commercials, Citing Pandemic
  7. Coca-Cola Will Sit Out Super Bowl, Joining Pepsi in Benching Soda Ads
  8. Pepsi Promises a Super Bowl Halftime Show, Even if the Game Is Canceled
  9. Budweiser Joins Coke and Pepsi Brands in Sitting Out First COVID-Era Super Bowl
  10. WATCH: Bigger Picture | Budweiser Super Bowl Commercial
  11. Why Budweiser and their signature Clydesdales are skipping the Super Bowl for first time in 37 years
  12. How Super Bowl ad costs have skyrocketed over the years
  13. WATCH: Harrison - Around You

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
